parameters: Welcome back! I'd forgotten to mention this last time, but we have habits for the volunteers to wear while working here. I know you aren't actually a sister or anything, but it helps promote a sense of unity for everyone to have matching clothes, and I think you'd look super cute in them, so it's not optional! There's a changing room if you enter the back part of the building, so if you'd like to help out, you can go find something that fits you there.

Looks like she's taken you for a girl already. You consider correcting her, but blush when you remember how she snuggled you up to her chest yesterday. What if she thinks you led her on just to get close to her? Well, it's not like you knew she was going to smother you, but more importantly, what if she stops snuggling you because you're actually a boy? You'll have to just play along for now.
I explained it yesterday, but the tasks you can help with include doling out soup, watching the soup lines, and making soup. Well, it's not \fialways\fi soup, but most of the time it is.
Regardless of which soup related task you'd like to try your hand at, you should probably get changed first.

As always, you can help out by doling out soup, managing the lines for the soup, or making the soup. It's soup no matter how you go about it. Sister Ann will be busy helping out the volunteers, so if you have anything to talk about with her, you'll have to volunteer first.
Oh, now that you've gotten the hang of helping out here, you could also help out in the kitchen making soup, if you'd like.

As always, you can help out by doling out soup, managing the lines for the soup, or making the soup. It's soup no matter how you go about it. Sister Ann will be busy helping out the volunteers, so if you have anything to talk about with her, you'll have to volunteer first.

The church gets quite a bit quieter after the days soup has been given out. There's no work left for you to do here today, so you'll have to come back tomorrow if you want to volunteer again. You could talk to Sister Ann now though, if you'd like.
The church gets quite a bit quieter after the days soup has been given out. There's no work left for you to do here today, so you'll have to come back tomorrow if you want to help with volunteering.
Ready to head back into the church?
Are you here to volunteer? I could certainly use the help.
A cute fountain depicting the Goddess. No, this one isn’t magical either. Toss a coin into the fountain?
Your defensive power increases by 1. Did this fountain have some residual power from the Goddess?
Your depravity decreases by 5. Did this fountain have some residual power from the Goddess?
Nothing happened. It looks like you won’t be getting anything else out of this fountain.
Psst, hey kid, wanna hear a secret? I'm not actually poor, the Church just cooks better than me wife does, \fbhahaha!\fb
<CC Face: 1>You know we are only supposed to give soup out to those who need it, right? If you don’t actually need the soup, you aren’t getting any.
...\| \fs[16]I don't even have a wife, sorry...
Please don't deny me my soup...
Seems she's uttering a prayer to the Goddess, better leave her be.
The church's donation box. Contributing money to help the church continue supporting those in need will certainly help you feel better about yourself, reducing your \C[30]depravity.
You don't really have cash to give away at the moment though.
